Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for integrating existing services with Azure API Management. Identify the services to be exposed and the necessary security and performance requirements.
Create a new Azure API Management instance in the Azure portal. Choose the appropriate pricing tier based on the expected load and features required.
Import existing APIs into the API Management instance. This can include REST APIs, SOAP services, or OpenAPI specifications.
Set up security measures such as OAuth 2.0, API keys, and IP whitelisting to protect the APIs exposed through API Management.
Define and configure policies for the APIs, such as rate limiting, caching, and transformation policies to manage API behavior.
Integrate Azure Key Vault for managing secrets and certificates used in API Management. Ensure that sensitive information is securely stored.
Set up Azure Monitor and Application Insights to track API usage, performance metrics, and error rates.
Conduct thorough testing of the APIs to ensure they function as expected. This includes testing security configurations and performance under load.
Set up and customize the developer portal for API consumers to access documentation, test APIs, and manage subscriptions.
Set up CI/CD pipelines using Azure DevOps or GitHub Actions to automate the deployment of API changes and updates.
Provide training sessions for the development team on how to use and manage the API Management instance effectively.
Implement procedures to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and conduct regular audits of API usage and security.

Tasks.Task: Integrate API Management with Service Fabric
Tasks.Task Description: Set up Azure API Management to route traffic to back-end services hosted in Service Fabric. Ensure proper configuration of API operations to communicate with the ASP.NET Core stateless service.
Add front-end API operations in API Management, specifying display names, HTTP methods, and URL templates to ensure proper communication with the back-end services.
Configure VNet integration for the API Management instance to allow secure access to network-isolated back-end services. Ensure that the API Management gateway remains publicly accessible.
Define and implement policies in API Management to control API behavior, including authentication, throttling, and caching. Ensure policies are aligned with security and performance requirements.
Utilize Azure Monitor and Application Insights to track the performance and health of APIs managed by API Management. Set up alerts for any anomalies or performance issues.
Regularly review and update the API documentation available on the developer portal to ensure it reflects the current state of the APIs and their operations.
Perform regular security audits of the API Management instance to ensure compliance with security policies and best practices. Address any identified vulnerabilities.
Regularly back up the API Management configuration, including policies, products, and API definitions, to ensure recovery in case of data loss.
Ensure the operations team participates in continuous training to stay updated with new features, best practices, and security measures related to API Management.
Analyze API usage metrics and analytics to understand consumption patterns and identify opportunities for optimization and improvement.
